title: How to Make Aguachile

steps.headline: Prepare the shrimp.
steps.description: Peel, devein, and wash the shrimp. Let them drain for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Marinate them.
steps.description: Place the shrimp in a bowl and cover them with the juice of 7 limes or 4 lemons.

steps.headline: Let them rest.
steps.description: Put the bowl with the shrimp in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. They will marinate better if you cover the bowl. Once the shrimp are marinated, drain them and put them aside for plating.

steps.headline: Process the ingredients.
steps.description: Put the chili peppers, cilantro, and juice of 3 limes (or 2 lemons) in a blender. Process them until you have a uniform mixture.

steps.headline: Marinate the onion (optional).
steps.description: Finely slice the onion and place it in a bowl. Cover the slices with the juice of 2 limes (or 1 lemon).

steps.headline: Prepare the cucumbers.
steps.description: Slice the cucumbers; season them with salt, pepper, and a bit of lime juice. Put them aside for plating. You can also season the cucumbers with chili powder, depending on how spicy you want to dish to be.

steps.headline: Plate the dish.
steps.description: Place all of the ingredients on a platter or large plate. First, place a layer of cucumbers on the plate. Then, put the shrimp on top. Cover the shrimp with the sliced onion. Pour the chili mixture over the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Decorate the edge of the plate with tomato and/or avocado slices.

text: Part 1: Prepare the shrimp Prepare the shrimp. Peel, devein, and wash the shrimp. Let them drain for 5 minutes. Marinate them. Place the shrimp in a bowl and cover them with the juice of 7 limes or 4 lemons. Let them rest. Put the bowl with the shrimp in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. They will marinate better if you cover the bowl. Once the shrimp are marinated, drain them and put them aside for plating. Part 2: Prepare the sauce Process the ingredients. Put the chili peppers, cilantro, and juice of 3 limes (or 2 lemons) in a blender. Process them until you have a uniform mixture. Marinate the onion (optional). Finely slice the onion and place it in a bowl. Cover the slices with the juice of 2 limes (or 1 lemon). Prepare the cucumbers. Slice the cucumbers; season them with salt, pepper, and a bit of lime juice. Put them aside for plating. You can also season the cucumbers with chili powder, depending on how spicy you want to dish to be. Part 3: Finish the dish Plate the dish. Place all of the ingredients on a platter or large plate. First, place a layer of cucumbers on the plate. Then, put the shrimp on top. Cover the shrimp with the sliced onion. Pour the chili mixture over the other ingredients. Season with salt and pepper to taste.  Decorate the edge of the plate with tomato and/or avocado slices.
